linkTarget.anchoringText: In this example, structural analysis is reduced to calculating the static discrepancy for wells based on linear regression. The values of the wells and stratified intersections with the isochrones map are compared. After that, the regression equation is evaluated and applied to recalculate the values of the reflecting horizon from time to depth (Figure 1).

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Graph of time-depth correlation from reflection and reflexes in wells BP16-1

formatted-caption.caption-text: Graph of time-depth correlation from reflection and reflexes in wells BP16-1

linkTarget.anchoringText: The map of the structural map residuals with values in the wells was prepared in order to take into account the accuracy of the structural plan assessment (Figure 2,Figure 3). The minimum, average, maximum and standard deviations are estimated.

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: Structural map for the reservoir top BP16-1

formatted-caption.caption-text: Structural map for the reservoir top BP16-1

linkTarget.anchoringText: The map of the structural map residuals with values in the wells was prepared in order to take into account the accuracy of the structural plan assessment (Figure 2,Figure 3). The minimum, average, maximum and standard deviations are estimated.

image-wrap.label: Figure 3
image-wrap.caption: Map of residuals, calculated from seismic and wells heads BP16-1

formatted-caption.caption-text: Map of residuals, calculated from seismic and wells heads BP16-1

linkTarget.anchoringText: Analysis of the wave field dynamic characteristics was connected to the calculation of RGB maps with subsequent contouring of color anomalies (Figure 4). Since the contouring of these anomalies is quite unambiguous and confirmed by wells, the variability of their position in space has not been considered.

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: Example of calculating the RGB map and outlining the anomalies

formatted-caption.caption-text: Example of calculating the RGB map and outlining the anomalies

image-wrap.label: Figure 5
image-wrap.caption: Tornado-density of parameters sensitivity to initial geological reserves

formatted-caption.caption-text: Tornado-density of parameters sensitivity to initial geological reserves

linkTarget.anchoringText: The multivariate calculation was carried out in order to estimate the total spread of the oil reserves. The distribution histogram of the oil reservs (Figure 6) is constructed as a result of 300 realizations of the reserves calculation on the basis of 2D model.

image-wrap.label: Figure 6
image-wrap.caption: Histogram of distribution of initial geological reserves

formatted-caption.caption-text: Histogram of distribution of initial geological reserves

linkTarget.anchoringText: As a basis for determining measures to remove uncertainties, a matrix of risks and activities was adopted (Figure 7).

Figure (Figure 8) shows the initial decision tree of the example in question. In more detail, the optimization is as follows. At the initial moment, there are EMV values for each outcome. On them, starting from the very bottom of the tree, we choose the optimal solutions.

image-wrap.label: Figure 8
image-wrap.caption: Initial motion tree for the project (Example of stage 1)

formatted-caption.caption-text: Initial motion tree for the project (Example of stage 1)

linkTarget.anchoringText: As a result, the most reliable and profitable option is selected, excluding risky decisions. In this example, the calculation result is the decision tree shown in the figure (Figure 9).

image-wrap.label: Figure 9
image-wrap.caption: Optimized tree of motion solutions for the project

formatted-caption.caption-text: Optimized tree of motion solutions for the project
